definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: He is perfect as the sensitive but strong reporter.
sentences.chinese: 他把一個敏感而言詞犀利的記者演得完美無缺。

sentences.english: Foreign reporters weren't permitted inside a fence around the courthouse in western Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 外國記者被攔在位於滬西的法院柵欄外。

sentences.english: She has has experience as a reporter, but Greg and Thomas haven't.
sentences.chinese: 她有當記者的經歷，而格來格和托馬斯則沒有。

sentences.english: Following that, the two heads of state jointly met with journalists from the media of China, Chile and other countries.
sentences.chinese: 隨後兩國元首共同會見了中智兩國和國際傳媒記者。

sentences.english: Perkins recalls it as a great time to be a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 帕金斯回憶說，那是一個記者的黃金時期。

sentences.english: This is the news yesterday from the Provincial Quality Supervision Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 這是記者昨日從省質監局獲悉的。

sentences.english: In Gambia 11 journalists have been jailed for extended periods in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 在岡比亞，11名記者在2006年被判長期徒刑。

sentences.english: Journalists are studying the minister's speech for pointers to the contents of next month's policy statement.
sentences.chinese: 記者們在研究部長講話以揣摩下月施政報告中的動向。

sentences.english: Just worked to reporter station, I am to have some of feeling of two one bring shame on really.
sentences.chinese: 剛到記者站工作，我是真有些兩眼一抹黑的感覺。

sentences.english: The reporter wants to heckle the candidate with those embarrassing question.
sentences.chinese: 記者想用那些讓人難爲情的問題來刁難這位候選人。

sentences.english: In fact, reporters had been warned beforehand about the potentially over-aggressive conduct.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，記者們在之前被警告過潛在的侵犯行爲。

sentences.english: Debate of the two people to play up, drew a group of reporters to surround pat.
sentences.chinese: 爭論中兩人打了起來，引來了一羣記者的圍拍。

sentences.english: Reporter discovered that this year many brands spin the thing red by primarily .
sentences.chinese: 記者發現，今年許多品牌家紡用品還是以紅色爲主。

sentences.english: The journalists like to dish the dirt about television stars.
sentences.chinese: 記者有時喜歡揭電視明星的瘡疤。

sentences.english: Mila Kolesnikova is a Moscow actress and photo journalist.
sentences.chinese: 米拉，莫斯科的演員和攝影記者。

definition: to interview/to gather news/to hunt for and collect/to cover
to interview (a particular person or on a particular topic)/special interview/special report based on such an interview
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy
